law.text:
When the master commissioner is interested as an attorney or party; or
When there is other conflict of interest; or
When he is otherwise unable to discharge the duties of his office for any reason; the judge of the court before whom the action is pending shall appoint a special commissioner, who shall meet the same qualifications as a master commissioner, and require him to take an oath and execute a bond as the regular commissioner is required to do.
law.history: Created 1976 (1st Extra. Sess.) Ky. Acts ch. 22, sec. 51, effective January 2, 1978.
